par.text: Indium is a soft, malleable and ductile metal.

It is very soft and easily abraded on hard surfaces. Polished indium stays untarnished, because the element is resistant to corrosion. Indium reacts with oxygen when heated to form indium(III) oxide -

. Indium reacts also with the halogens, sulphur, selenium, phosphorus and nitrogen. Dissolves in acids but does not react with alkalis. Indium was discovered by two German chemists: Theodor Richter and Ferdinand Reich in 1863. The name is derived from the Latin
, meaning ”indigo”, because the metal's spectrum shows a prominent indigo blue line.
